DRDNetPro

Chixiang Chen

Source: vignettes/NAME-OF-VIGNETTE.Rmd
NAME-OF-VIGNETTE.Rmd

DRDNetPro is a statistical learning algorithm for recover disease risk-associated pseudo-dynamic networks (DRDNet) from steady-state data. It incorporates risk prediction model, a varying coefficient model, multiple ordinary differential equations, and group lasso estimation to learn a series of networks.This tutorial will provide detailed information for the first step of implementing the DRDNet.

Installation and other packages

To begin with, the user need to install our packages

if (!require("devtools")) {
  install.packages("devtools")
}
devtools::install_github("chencxxy28/DRDNetPro")

To run the following tutorial, the user need to install other packages listed below

library(pROC)
library(igraph)

The tutorial is organized in three sections. The user is recommended to sequentially go through these sections

Predict the agent

This section includes the content of preparing data, building the prediction model for the agent, and evaluating the model for the predicted agent. Please find the details in Tutorial 1

Train the network model

This section is the main section in DRDNetPro, which includes the content of preparing data, training the varying coefficient model for gene expressions, generating the base matrices for network learning, and training the network model. Please find the details in Tutorial 2

Visualize the results

This section includes the content of extracting the results from the trained network model, visualizing the fitted genes by the varying coefficient model, and visualizing the pseudo-dynamic network for a given agent value. Please find the details in Tutorial 3

Contents

Developed by Chixiang Chen.
